item.title: MiniGPT-4
item.description: MiniGPT-4, a language model that aligns a frozen visual encoder with a frozen large language model, Vicuna, using just one projection layer, possesses similar capabilities exhibited by GPT-4, such as generating detailed image descriptions and writing stories and poems inspired by given images.

item.title: RedPajama: Reproduction of LLaMA with friendly license
item.description: RedPajama, a project to create leading open-source models, starts by reproducing LLaMA training dataset of over 1.2 trillion tokens; RedPajama has three key components: pre-training data, base models, and instruction tuning data and models; RedPajama has released the full RedPajama 1.2 trillion token dataset and a smaller, more consumable random sample can be downloaded through Hugging Face.

item.title: Samsung considers moving to Bing as default search engine
item.description: Samsung is reportedly in talks with Microsoft to make Bing the default search engine on its Galaxy devices, including Android-based smartphones and tablets, with Google appearing to be in "panic mode."

item.title: I liked this simple calculus exercise
item.description: The author shares a calculus exercise that requires students to understand what the integral is computing, rather than just relying on set rules for integrating common functions.

item.title: Booting Modern Intel CPUs
item.description: - Booting modern Intel CPUs involves verifying signatures and executing Authenticated Code Modules (ACMs) for detecting attacks or malware.

item.title: iOS 17 will reportedly set the stage for sideloading apps on iPhone
item.description: Apple may be adding the ability to sideload apps on iPhones with the release of iOS 17, according to a Bloomberg report.

item.title: OpenAI's CEO says the age of giant AI models is already over
item.description: OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, stated that the era of making large language models like GPT is coming to a close.

item.title: Microsoft deleted the public support forums for SwiftKey
item.description: This text is not related to the title 'Microsoft deleted the public support forums for SwiftKey' and therefore cannot be summarized accordingly.

item.title: No Source Code == No Patent
item.description: - Disclosure of source code in software patents is important because it proves that an inventor can implement the invention and adds credibility to a patent, especially in infringement cases.

item.title: I made my blog solar-powered, then things escalated
item.description: A blogger built a solar-powered system to run their blog and computer desk using solar panels with a combined rating of 740 Watts, powered through a 12-volt system with a large used lead-acid battery, Victron solar charger, inverter and Filax 2 switch, and gathering data involves using Python, InfluxDB and Grafana to collect and display data.

item.title: Sold a Story: How Teaching Kids to Read Went So Wrong
item.description: American Public Media's investigative journalism project 'Sold a Story' debunks the current teaching methods in schools' reading programs, which are based on a long-disproven idea about how children learn to read, originally put forth by Marie Clay.

item.title: The Windows 11 Trash Party
item.description: The author of the article complains about the default content appearing in the Start menu of Windows 11 including a news about mass shooting that might be inappropriate for children, and garbage from the MSN home page in the weather info's alert.

item.title: Monthly Fediverse posts cross 1 billion for the first time
item.description: Monthly Fediverse posts have crossed one billion for the first time, according to recent data analysis.

item.title: AWS staff spending 'much of their time 'optimizing customers' clouds'
item.description: AWS staff are helping customers optimize their AWS spend so they can weather the uncertain economy, according to Amazon.com CEO Andy Jassy's annual letter to shareholders.

item.title: Starship Flight Test [video]
item.description: - SpaceX's latest Starship prototype, SN10, has successfully completed a high-altitude test flight and landing, making it the first one to land without exploding.
